creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: woman sitting on bench holding a snake in PR hand very closely to her face, as if talking to it; elbow from arm with snake extends outside of image plane
marks:
Signature

in graphite on recto, bottom of sheet signed in plate, far right: [A. Lepere]
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until September 17, 1994; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Snake Merchant
